website_summaries.verdict: A unique pair of panniers that features an exposed, open top design to quickly place items in when needed.
pros: Large size of the panniers is big enough for small groceries for a quick trip to the store
Panniers fold flat when not in use for easy storage when attached to the bike
Sold as a pair to outfit each side of a rack
cons: The open design of the bags is not suitable for keeping items secure while away from the bike

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful panniers for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for 3+ years and they've held up incredibly well with near-daily use. I've used them for everything from groceries, to sports equipment, to (this morning) carrying my 27lbs puppy to the vet. They're extremely durable, light, mount firmly, fold very thin, and are well sized. My only criticism is that they're don't mount/unmount very quickly, so I tend to leave them on my bike at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Egan

customer_reviews.title: nicely, needing no fiddling to make it work
customer_reviews.text: Fits my bike's rack, (Bontrager), nicely, needing no fiddling to make it work. A reusable grocery bag fits perfectly in each side, and they handle weight with no problem. 12 pack of beer on one side, gallon of milk on the other, with all the other groceries, works good. Just be mindful of the weight when loading and unloading as the bike can become unsteady while using the kickstand. Bottom line, they make my trip to the grocery much easier, and more productive. I like this product!
customer_reviews.author: John P.R.

customer_reviews.title: Essential part of a citibike.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy and carries a load. My big feet do bump the panniers when they are not in folded mode, if I keep my toes on the pedals, but this problem is easily remedied by moving my feet slightly forward on the pedals while carrying a load. This slight inconvenience is vastly outweighed by the convenience of carrying two full grocery bags (not counting what you can put on the rack itself). The fact that the fold flat while mounted gives the added convenience of leaving them on the bike all the time, which is good for unplanned stops at a store.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: fits on our bike rack. well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: by mistake I underestimated the weight of cases of bottled water and bought 2 cases at the store. (24 bottles 16.9 ounces). I put one case in each side. the rack and bags held up on my ride home. I definitely would NOT recommend doing this, because of the bulk and weight, and I definitely would NOT do it again. but I only mention it because the bags and bike rack were actually sturdy enough to handle this load. when I got home out of curiosity I weighed the 2 cases of water and it totaled about 60 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: babasaurus

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea,  poor execution... run away
customer_reviews.text: After finally figuring out a way to fasten to bike without falling off every slight bump on the road. First trip (1.5 miles) to grocery store on the way back the weight of a single bag of groceries rubbed the back of the tire wearing the bungy half way through. Soon to be useless! Update: Just a few weeks of use Fell off lost!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Curry

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Well Made
customer_reviews.text: The baskets are sturdy and well-made. We have them on our folding bikes and they take a beating. With smaller frames and 20" wheels, the basket may stick out, just a fraction of an inch, but enough to hit with the heel of your foot when the pedal comes around. A zip tie or other fastener to pull it back a bit resolved it easily. They fold flat enough to leave in place when folding the bikes and putting them back in the storage bags and they are much gentler on the bike frames than the metal folding baskets.
customer_reviews.author: Kellirae  Boann

customer_reviews.title: Were great while they lasted
customer_reviews.text: While more than doubled the capacity of what I usually carry, they also turned out to be more popular than the one saddle bag which was the first used, and never bothered to secure to my bike. Still got a few good months of use out them before some - probably can't use that kind of language here - help themselves to them. Live from boneheaded mistake and learn. Will get around to re-ordering them someday. And yes, talking about someone stealing them. Otherwise they were pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. May

customer_reviews.title: Big beefy bags
customer_reviews.text: These hold up well, can hold a lot of weight to them and for the most part stay in place, the only real trouble I've had with them is actually getting on the bike with these massive things on the back. It's a bit more like getting on a horse where you have to swing your leg up and over in one quick motion. I also like that you can put them on, or take them off again in just a quick minute, really easy to just have on when you want to go to the store, and keep them folded and out of the way any other time.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot but had to jury rig it to get it to stay on
customer_reviews.text: I love how much I can carry with these bags. I can take by bicycle to the grocery store or even Costco. (Keep in mind, I'm only shopping for one person.) My only complaint was they would not stay on at first. The bags would pop off the rails on my luggage rack--very annoying. So, I took a couple of bungees and looped them around the center post, and the bags have stayed in place. Unfortunately, it's no longer practical to take the bags off when I don't need them. Still, overall a great product. Also, the bags might work better with skinnier luggage rack rails than I have.
customer_reviews.author: William Kutscher

customer_reviews.title: brackets
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to go on my bike to hold kids stuff when going to park. The brackets that should go on the bike are not one size fits all. they are too little for either adult bike I own. Need to send different size brackets or sell them with different sizes. Because the brackets do not fit right the bag part drags on tires
customer_reviews.author: Mander97

customer_reviews.title: Just another over-priced horribly constructed product
customer_reviews.text: Just another over-priced horribly constructed product. The backing on these that supports them against the rack is a super thin, flimsy, flexible piece of plastic. I put one gallon of milk in them and the plastic bowed away from the frame so far I was nervous riding home that that screws were going to pull out. Accident waiting to happen. I just returned them. They can't possibly last long. Would have been a decent product if they had used a rigid backing that was built to last. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: noOne

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but not the most stable connection
customer_reviews.text: These are quality bags. However, how they connect to a bike is a little iffy. There's a little piece of bungee-like cord with a little S-clip on the bottom of the bags that are supposed to attach "somewhere" stable. On my bike, there's no good place to attach the S-clip, so I ended up having to McGyver the bags so I could actually use them for their intended purpose. Trouble is, on bumpyish roads, the S-clips end up slipping off, which has, on more than on occasion, sent my groceries a-tumbling. Most unfortunate. Especially for my eggs and my hopes for an omelette.
customer_reviews.author: Dale A. Nacke

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! 1. The weight is negligible, but I can fill them up to the top with groceries and they will not rip. 2. Easy on, easy off. Can take them right into the store with me. NB: The S-hooks on the bungie-cords are too small for my Ibera rack. I was not able to open them up with pliers, so I used zip-ties to form a loop on each lower crossbar of my Ibera rack, and then attached the s-hooks to those instead of the rack itself.
customer_reviews.author: Blackbearfamily

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product, Works Really Well for Me.
customer_reviews.text: I've used them several times now. They just work great, very convenient to put on and take off, I can very easily take them in the store and load them as I shop, so I know exactly how much I can buy and carry home with me. Now when I take my bike to the grocery store, I call it the Freighter Bike. Combined with a backpack, I'm spending more on groceries now than I did when I had a car.
customer_reviews.author: Detector

customer_reviews.title: Great Pannier's
customer_reviews.text: These Pannier's are great. Well worth the money. Easy to install. I bought them for my son to deliver newspapers with. They work perfect. Are sturdy with the board in the bottom for support. The bungi cord tie down on the bottom secures them to the bike and keeps them from moving or shifting. They are easy to remove if needed. They fold flat very nicely when not in use. We mounted them on his Schwinn Men's bike. They are designed to fit on a rear luggage carrier with round bars. Don't believe they will fit on his old Schwinn that has a flat luggage carrier, but haven't tried that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene King

customer_reviews.title: Great set of bags; wish it had handles on both sides for carrying.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set of bags for your bike. Pros: 1. Light weight. 2. Universal attachment. 3. Folds up for storage when not in use. Cons: 1. When walking around the farmers market (or your place of shopping), there is only one handle. So you either end up holding the bag with both arms, or you use the single handle and walk around with it (lopsided) hoping nothing falls out. This is a minor "con", but it does actually become quite annoying after a while. However, I would still highly recommend these and would buy again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dodge

customer_reviews.title: best bike shopping bag i knowk of
customer_reviews.text: sturdy fold... doesn't sag too much under a load. This is an amazing solution for commuting / having as a storage space for any bike. great material... great quality... highly useful. ONLY CON.... depending on your build... there is a SLIGHT chance that you might heal strike the bags while pedaling. Most racks allow you to just adjust them further back... but your experience may differ.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Good panniers, but need a better folding system to make them great.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: They hold a lot of weight. I've had groceries and an 36pack of water bottles in both sides. When they're folded up there is room to keep reusable grocery bags in there but that takes us to the cons... Cons: The two snap buttons that hold the bag in the folding position start to loose their 'tension' after several uses and I've found my bags starting to sag. This isn't such a big deal but I'd love to have the snaps buttons on a strap that can be tensioned tightly to keep it more aero and this will also allow you more options to keep it "folded" and keep things in the bag at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Normal Guy

customer_reviews.title: Bad hooks. Does not stay on bikes
customer_reviews.text: Love how it opens wide. Perfect for shopping. Only problem is it won't stay on the bike. It depends on gravity hit a pothole and lose your groceries Sirius new line I will try to adjust the size of the hooks for the rack because I really want this to work. If it had a shoulder strap it would be unbelievable wonderful
customer_reviews.author: pellegrino

customer_reviews.title: Be careful getting off.
customer_reviews.text: The bags themselves are great. They are very easy to attach & remove from my bike. They're also roomy & they fold up nicely when not in use, so you don't have to take them off completely. However, I've caught my foot on one (twice) when they were open. I have to swing my leg higher to get off my bike. Learned that the hard way with scrapes & bruises. I still like them too much to take them off.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Crispin

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and with lots of room
customer_reviews.text: these are the best "bike saddlebags" I have used. They are surprisingly sturdy. I often use them for transporting groceries, and have never had them give out even with two jugs of milk in just one of the packs. they are easy to put on and take of when needed, yet they never fall of even in bumpy situations. I've used them regularly for about a year and a half, and they are still in superb condition.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to attach to my bikes while at the beach to make short runs to the store. Works as intended. Easy to install on a hybrid bike. Able to carry small amounts of groceries (one to two bags at a time) including milk, liter bottles, and others. When done, simple to fold and store.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mo

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: Overall these are good. They are easy to put on and take off the bike. They do hold a sack of groceries on each side but I felt the need to bungee across the top because the weight of the groceries does make the baskets bow out which doesn’t inspire confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M.

customer_reviews.title: Bike Rack Pannier/Side Bags
customer_reviews.text: Purchase for green market runs. Clips hold well but figuring out the strap to keep tight and secure was some effort with my bike rack (west bike rack 310lb from Amazon) and assume it would be that for other independent to various racks. Otherwise, holds well when loaded but not conducive to easy on/off use due to strap configuration .
customer_reviews.author: CO Boy

customer_reviews.title: Work great, nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Work great, nice and sturdy, and even when they are folded up I can still stuff some things in there like a jacket or my U-lock. They are huge and stick out from the bike a little bit more than normal panniers. At first I thought maybe a little bit too big, but it has been helpful for big grocery loads. The bottom bungee with hook works so-so, just depends on your rack. Works good on my bike, but a bit tricky to get a good lock on my girlfriend bike, the pannier almost fell off one time. Otherwise, a nice set of grocery/do-it-all panniers for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and roomy
customer_reviews.text: I love these saddle bags! I have been using them for over a month now. They are quick and easy to put on and take off (5 seconds), fold down for easy storage, very durable, don't move around on the bike (S-hook keeps them in place) and very roomy. I can put over 2 bags of groceries in them.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The clasp on the basket doesn't attached securely as you can see in the picture, it pop off twice during my ride. I've attached the extra bungees to it and that sort of helps it stay secure. but for the price I shouldn't have to go through all that for $64 it should just work as advertised 😣
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved me in a bike vs auto accident.
customer_reviews.text: Love these baskets! I originally bought these to carry a cooler back and forth from my dog sitting houses and my day job. Recently I acquired Buzz and he hangs back there now. I want to say, these may not look like much but they do their job. Just two weeks ago, I was in a bike vs auto accident. I am alive and ok. Had I not had this basket on my fall would have been worse. I do wear a helmet but having the basket and Buzz, cushioned my fall. Thank you for making good product! I also have the trunk bag which I’ll also have to review.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Love these panniers!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use with my Dahon 20" foldie. And now we can go grocery shopping on the bike! They're sturdy and stable. Reusable grocery bags fit nicely inside. When riding while empty, or near empty, my heels did clip the pannier once or twice, until I got the hang out it, causing it to pop off mid ride. But by mounting the bags a little further back on my rack, tying them down more tightly with extra bungees, and paying more attention to pedaling, I haven't had that experience again. I like the reinforced and squared off bottoms of the bags. They also fold up for storage and we just keep them on the bike all the time. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie L. Tamaribuchi

customer_reviews.title: Good, if you're up for some DIY fixes
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, pretty strong, and a little bit bigger than a standard US paper grocery bag. I use it daily. Two gripes: 1) When I ride over bump/curb/pothole, the bags bounce off my rack and drag behind my bike. Fixed this by tying the hooks down with paracord. 2) Stupid place for the mounting hooks: the bags ride too high to still use the rack's shelf, and with heavy stuff in the bag there's too much bending stress on edges the plastic backing plate. This guy said it (and fixed it) better than I could:
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Those are the best baskets ever
customer_reviews.text: Those are the best baskets ever. I do my weekly shopping with my bike. They can handle very heavy loads. Not so sure how many lbs/Kgs but I often go overboard...To tell you the bike is so heavy that I need to make sure to find the balance before cycling! They are easy enough to take off but I leave them on all the time. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie M

customer_reviews.title: A fold-away trunk for your bike
customer_reviews.text: Wow...a simple way to transport groceries and gear that folds up flat when I am not using it. Bought it for my husband to give to me for Xmas, but was so excited when I opened them that I couldn't wait and installed them to start using right away. Pros: --dead simple to install if you already have a rear bike rack. Took about 30 seconds. --folds flat and snaps to hold it flat when you are not using them. --easily holds a grocery bag in each side --seems pretty well built Cons: -- a little pricey - but you do get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Phbrowne

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: These are made well, and hold a decent amount. Like others have said they will hold a 24 pack. I have some canvas grocery bags that are larger than brown paper bags, one fits perfectly in each side. I only wish that the top of the bags would sit flush with the rack, but not a big deal at all though. I have used them for about 6 months, 1-2 grocery runs per week, and they are not showing any signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M

customer_reviews.title: Great for light grocery shopping and errands
customer_reviews.text: Bought these paneers to shop with, only used them a couple times. Fit my rear rack even with a rear bag. Was concerned about hitting it with my heel, but that didn’t occur. Met all expectations. Quick install & removal.
customer_reviews.author: Snosnake

customer_reviews.title: Makes shopping a breeze
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for nearly a year now and use them for grocery shopping three times a week and I load them to the brim and beyond. Not one bit of wear showing and everything is still tight even though I leave them on all the time. I also always use the straps to close them and they are working flawlessly. I can't say enough good things about these panniers. If I should ever need to replace them I would buy exactly the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Docwormburner

customer_reviews.title: Great shopping panniers!
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and with bungee cord and ties, these are very flexible with nice profile for all your grocery needs. Holds a lot of weight if balanced. Had for six months. Expecting several years of good use.
customer_reviews.author: dejah-thoris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to us and carries a full load
customer_reviews.text: I needed an easy to use, high capacity, and sturdy cargo carrier. This makes going to the market, Farmer's Market, and other shopping needs. It folds up very neatly and clips securely to a typical bike rack
customer_reviews.author: VSH

customer_reviews.title: Nice but send the equipment that should be with it!
customer_reviews.text: Love the baskets but cannot understand why it only came with one QR attachment to keep it attached to t he rack when they only sell them in pairs? the downside is that if you dont have these weighed down they will rattle and jump off the rack. I use them for now, but am researching better options for lift off baskets. Also they do not have carrying handles for shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Mariyah R

customer_reviews.title: can fit 1 (over) full shopping hand basket pretty easily. I've lugged around 36 packs of beer ...
customer_reviews.text: Been regularly using my grocery panniers for a few years now. Regular use being filling to the brim shopping every other week. Combined, can fit 1 (over) full shopping hand basket pretty easily. I've lugged around 36 packs of beer in it as well. Given price and how well it works, 5 stars. Would actually be nice if it a top handle, but given it's design not sure how well that would work.
customer_reviews.author: Divx

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My 13lb dogs love these baskets !!!! Really easily to assemble
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping, easy to fold, easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: I received the pannier in about 3 days through prime. Arrival, the panniers were smaller than I expected but was amazed at the ease of installation. The material was very light weight and easy to fold. Works great as advertised and hope to use them for a long time. I’ve used them for 2 days so far hope to get at least a year of use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: I've carried my groceries by bicycle exclusively for five years now. That means I put about 30 pounds of weight onto my bicycle on a regular basis. A previous set of panniers that I had purchased was poorly made and tore within a year. These are affixed to the bicycle very sturdily with solid metal parts that don't allow the pannier to shift or sag, and open to a very sturdy grocery bag shape that I wouldn't be afraid to put 25 pounds in. The folding design also works very nicely; one can put a bike lock in the folded bag without it shifting around. I expect these will last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: R. Viewer

customer_reviews.title: No secure locking system
customer_reviews.text: Heel strike caused the front hook to come loose. The pannier was dangling by one hook with groceries inside, including a bottle of wine. This could have ended badly. Had to stop and reattach the hook. Didn't take too long, but having all my groceries fly out because of heel strike is too much of a risk. Something with a secure locking system would be much better.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: You hit them when you pedal
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that these saddle bags are collapsible. And they are easy to install and remove. Each pannier can hold an entire bag of groceries. I wish that I could move them further back because they sometimes interfere with my feet when I am pedaling.
customer_reviews.author: GLS from Michigan

customer_reviews.title: They fall off easily
customer_reviews.text: These fall off very easily. I wish I had the chance to use them more before the return period, but I didn't and now I'm stuck with them. They do NOT stay on. The metal hinges are simply too shallow to grip the bike rack adequately.
customer_reviews.author: S Moon

customer_reviews.title: These are great. They've just about turned my beater bike into ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They've just about turned my beater bike into a truck. Mount quickly. Load very fast in checkout line vs floppy cloth bags. Dismount easily so I can shoulder bike and carry panniers straight to kitchen. Affordable and highly recommended, should have bought them sooner. Some have noted that they could dislodge when riding over a bump, manufacturer could probably remedy this with a slightly deeper hook.
customer_reviews.author: jon yang

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy lifestyle upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Well built, extremely practical. If you carry stuff on your bike these will make you very happy. Great deal as they are a pair. Attached to my rack securely yet easy to put on and take off. Slim when folded for aero. If you are considering a way to carry stuff on your bike this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: So easy to take on and off bike rack
customer_reviews.text: This is the best I've found yet. I use them for weekly groceries and daily workbag. I wish they were 25% stronger because when I put a 64 oz growler in there it bows considerably but it's not catching in the spokes so I'll keep on moving. When they breakdown I will buy them again. I think they will last 1.5 years with my level of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for groceries shopping
customer_reviews.text: I used the panniers for the first time today and they are exactly what I was looking for. Size is perfect and fits a large grocery bag. I carried around 30 pounds in each bag and it held up nicely. Connecting the panniers was very easy and took 2 minutes. Highly recommended for grocery shopping.
customer_reviews.author: I. Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built product in use for nine months
customer_reviews.text: I gave up my car about nine months ago and purchased these for big loads. They are awesome! They fold up quickly when not in use and are able to hold an impressive amount of stuff, with stable bike handling being maintained. I'm able to drop my messenger bag, a coat and other random items in just one side. They also are sturdy enough to allow me to strap things to the top, using my rack as an anchor point for the bungee. I'd buy them again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: csb

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my wife as a Christmas gift since she like to ride her bike to the nearby grocery store. These panniers exceeded expectations. The construction is very heavy duty and quality - we really load these things down with groceries. They fold up out of the way when there's no bags in them and they are easy to take on/off when she doesn't need them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Gold Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my electric bike as I travel to the market frequently with bike. They are perfect, not to heavy and sturdy. The size is good, plenty of room for several groceries. The basket can fold up when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Simonson

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and durable
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for about two years now. They're very convenient for groceries and anything else I want to carry with me, such as bike locks, backpacks, etc. They're durable, fold up nicely, attach tightly to the bike rack, and are quite sturdy when unfolded. For transporting small light things that might fly out, I recommend bungie cords, tie downs or a cargo net.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Well built, pricy, but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Want to go buy groceries on your bike? Then you need this. It’s really really well built, folds up and out of the way with a small snapping strap. Holds a ton of weight, and doesn’t flop around when attached to your rack. All around fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Hines

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these.
customer_reviews.text: These fit a paper shopping bag perfectly and fold up nice and flat. They won't rust, because they're nylon, I think. You have to really stretch the elastic at the bottom quite a bit to find someplace on the rack "legs" to attach to. Then you just latch the black curved thingies at the top to the seat. They fold nice and flat, so I can lock my bike to a post in the carport and still get by when the car is there. Well worth the money. I can ride along with them closed with my gorilla lock slipped inside.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Maven

customer_reviews.title: They hold shopping bags or my lunch just fine. I used to have a cargo bike and ...
customer_reviews.text: Have these on my commuter bike. They hold shopping bags or my lunch just fine. I used to have a cargo bike and got tired of the size. These give me all the capacity I really need on any given day.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cummins

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and Secure
customer_reviews.text: We use these bags to haul fishing gear on our mountain bikes. They've taken some abuse and still look and function well and fold-up out of the way when not needed. The only critique I would offer is to add some simple security straps across the top, but we fixed that with some light duty bungee straps.
customer_reviews.author: JimV

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed and constructed.
customer_reviews.text: It was so easy to install, after I read the instructions. I had initially over complicated the process.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: They handle my grocery shopping just fine. They will each hold just about a grocery ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for a few months now, here in moist Seattle. They handle my grocery shopping just fine. They will each hold just about a grocery bag full of stuff. I have had no issues with them. I kinda smile when I pass the riders with the $100 + each panniers. A plastic bag keeps my stuff just as dry for about 3 cents. You can jam a bunch of stuff in them. Buy them if you do your shopping/commuting like me. Simple design that works.
customer_reviews.author: Old School MTB

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Supports two small digs only issue needs a better mount option for racks falls off less u drill a hole and zip tie it.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Donner

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this on his daily bike rides and picks up everything that falls off open trucks and trailers. It’s holding up well!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne M. Masden

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit the bike
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love it but it didn't fit my bike, which I couldn't tell from the description. Disappointing and I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Momof4

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for commuting
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these after a couple weeks of use. They seem very sturdy yet simple to use and put on/take off. It is a revelation to have so much carrying capacity that simply folds up when not in use and so discrete and un-fussy that I don't worry about them when I park my bike. Typical pannier bags are more expensive and really better suited to touring so these are a happy acquisition.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Love these baskets!
customer_reviews.text: We used them for short trips to the market and pop them off to take in with us to hold our purchases. We love them for long trips because they hold a lot and they're easy to get things in and out of. Not so good if you're riding in the rain and want to keep contents dry.
customer_reviews.author: Marli

customer_reviews.title: practical, versatile
customer_reviews.text: Great for groceries, beachwear, general shopping and transporting of items as I use my bicycle (instead of a car). Very much like it is easy to remove for when I only want one on my bike; and re-attach when two are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Riera

customer_reviews.title: A good replacement for my old ones
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for quite a while for replacement of my old (15 years or so) similar panniers. The Bushwhacker ones are very similar and I am please with them. I live in a large condo complex and ride my bicycle whenever possible to pick up mail, go to the pool or bocce court. The bags are just what I need. I can also take a bike trail to the public library and shopping center and have to have bags for holding books or groceries.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen C. Rounds

customer_reviews.title: Great product and seller
customer_reviews.text: Item exactly as described- would definitely buy from this seller again!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit my bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I have an Electra bike with a built-in rack on the back. The clips were too narrow to fit so I had to return them. I gave them three stars because I'm sure they would have been fine if they had fit.
customer_reviews.author: N. Marin

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: I bought to use for grocery shopping but they are so handy I use them for all sorts of cargo, I love that they fold up while mounted on my bike so they are always there when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rea

customer_reviews.title: Large and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Very sturdy, and they dont jostle around. Exactly what I was looking for to do quick grocery trips. They are each holding about 10 lbs in this picture. If they fall apart quick, I will revise this review.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: Grocery shopping on E-bike just became fun.
customer_reviews.text: Very good purchase. Holds large grocery bags without compromising balance. The paniers fold flat and stay out of the way when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Chickenhand

customer_reviews.title: Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: Distorts with minimal load and top aft bracket on both units unhooks. Also interference with my heel when peddling. For the price I expected more. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Skippy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted! Perfect baskets that have lots of room and can fit almost anything.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Watts

customer_reviews.title: Great Pannier
customer_reviews.text: So easy to install, silent when riding. Can carry groceries easily or backpack
customer_reviews.author: Dixie

customer_reviews.title: Fell off in traffic
customer_reviews.text: It uses open hooks and an ellastic band to hold it on the bike. If you hit a bump in the road and your load is not heavy enough it will dump it all.
customer_reviews.author: Michael nettles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for moderate carry Jobs
customer_reviews.text: These work fine. One arrived without the bungee cord attachment, but the cord itself doesn't really work with my particular rear rack. They are well made. The fold up feature is very helpful. I take them off the bike, into the grocery store and have them pack all my groceries right into these. Then hang on the rear rack and ride off to home. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: What a great price compared to my local bike shop
customer_reviews.text: What a great price compared to my local bike shop. Its basically 2 for one. Ive been using it constantly since receiving it and I am very pleased with the pannier.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M.

customer_reviews.title: right sized saddlebags that collapse easily and quickly when not needed
customer_reviews.text: Solid, right sized saddlebags that collapse easily and quickly when not needed. I use them pretty much daily, as I am located in a place where bicycles are the normal form of transportation. Only thing I think might improve the sale would be the addition of set up installation instructions. Although it only took me a few minutes to put my bags on, I wasn't exactly sure how I was supposed to use the "S" shaped fasteners. I made good use of them I think, but am not sure I used them the way in which they were intended to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Richardson

customer_reviews.title: While being the best thing for the job and the price they are ...
customer_reviews.text: While being the best thing for the job and the price they are a bit flimsy. I do not have a lot of confidence in their carrying capacity. You will likely have to my something in the nut and bolt section of a Hardware store (HomeDepot...) to have a place to hook the bungees so they don't pop off when you hit a bump.
customer_reviews.author: Vale

customer_reviews.title: Exactly all-around baskets for your bike
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. It can hold everything from my gym back (albeit, on it's side), to a full grocery bag on each side. You can add or remove very easily, which means you only have them on when you need them. I've had a few 12-packs of beer with no problems. Mine have held up great after some heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little Grocery Getters
customer_reviews.text: I love these panniers. I do a lot of biking and I always seem to end up carrying everyone's stuff. The fact that I can throw the stuff in here and not have to wear a backpack is fantastic. I store my bike vertically so I just collapse them down and put my bike away. I have resolved to make Grocery trips on bike this Spring and these are a big help. Great construction. The only bad thing I have to say about these is that I wish the clips were more rounded so they would hang more securely on the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Blacksher

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: This product is poorly made. The customer service is terrible also, been trying to return forever to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: bren

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Really nice product. Easily holds the newer, reusable grocery bags and strong enough to carry jugs of milk. Easy to install. Of course, rack not included so ignore the reviewer who gave it one star because it was misleading. I have occasionally hit the carriers with my heel when I've not made sure to slide them all the way back on the rack, but otherwise have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Totally needed item!
customer_reviews.text: These are what every around town biker needs! Working at night cleaning business's and schools I have to carry all kinds on supplies on my bike so I bought these and there perfect. They hold what you give them! I've overloaded them a few times (don't do it) with no problem at all! These really saved me, with work and shopping.
customer_reviews.author: nanimal

customer_reviews.title: They stay put, don't rattle, fold out of ...
customer_reviews.text: They stay put, don't rattle, fold out of the way when not in use, and perfectly fit a paper or reusable style shopping bag. I can't think of a single improvement that could be made. I put one on my bike and one of my daughter's bike- she puts her 20+ lb backpack in one side to ride to school everyday with no problem. And no signs of wear yet!
customer_reviews.author: Megan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great to carry lots of things
customer_reviews.text: This is the best solution I have found to carry groceries on your bike with a rear rack, and also works great if you do food delivery with your bike as well. Fits larger items that other rack cages I had before would not.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Pack

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Stays in Place
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for groceries. As an urban dweller I don't own a car so these are great for my shopping trips.As advertised each pannier holds a full size grocery bag. The small bungee cords hold each one firmly in place so they do not shift on turns nor more on bumpy roads..
customer_reviews.author: Deadwood

customer_reviews.title: i love them. they work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: i love them. they work perfectly. much better than expected...it can carry a lot of thing. there is a lot of space. they are also very good to carry weight.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Belen Eguiguren

customer_reviews.title: this one is perfect. Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: For years i have try so many, this one is perfect. Easy to install, but you do need a back rack.
customer_reviews.author: Henriette

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best panniers I’ve owned. Versatile and hold alot of groceries. Fold up easily in place.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Stankowski, III

customer_reviews.title: Great panniers once I got them installed
customer_reviews.text: Great panniers once I got them installed. However, that installation was much more difficult than I expected. They clip right on, but also need to be secured using a bungie cord, which was hard with the shape of my rack. Now that they're attached, they work very well for the grocery trips and rides around town. My husband has also borrowed them to hold his bag for work.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: One broke right away. No way to replace
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced and broke right away. Tried contacting manufacturer twice to get replacement bad but couldn't. I'm forced to write a negative review unless someone contacts me and finds a way to make this right. Within two months of owning these bags, one had a hook loosen and fall off. I've not been able to get a replacement hook or bag. The other has gone strong and carried many heavy loads, so I can only conclude that quality is haphazard and unpredictable. It would not be an issue, IF the bags were easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: TY

customer_reviews.title: Okay product.
customer_reviews.text: One side was stronger in holding weight than the other. Was durable and useful for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Jean

customer_reviews.title: great product. excellent price.
customer_reviews.text: Awesom product. Attached to my bike rack in seconds. Been commuting to work daily with my laptop computer bag in the bushwacker and then a bungee cord over the top for a little extra security. Have also used it for groceries. Would definitely recommend. Have only been using one so far but will keep the 2nd one on hand when I intend to make a big grocery run.
customer_reviews.author: penaltyboxagain

customer_reviews.title: Small hooks, fall of easily
customer_reviews.text: These have very small hooks and fall off the bike constantly. Had to zip tie the handles to bike to keep on and not that seam is tearing.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of grocery panniers
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought these for use with a Topeak Explorer bike rack, and they are exactly what I needed. They are sturdy, and a fully-loaded grocery bag (either paper or reusable) slips right in. For a very full bag, sometimes I have to guide it a little on the way in or out, but the dimensions are just right. The panniers fold up to a slim profile when not in use for more aerodynamic riding, and are very easy to install and remove from the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cravens

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great storage capacity. easy to install or remove but stays secure.
customer_reviews.author: dave22q

customer_reviews.title: Great for groceries and garage sales...
customer_reviews.text: Seemed a little expensive so I took my time making the decision but am very happy I purchased this set of bike bags. Excellent quality and capacity and fold up quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Online purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Okay setup
customer_reviews.text: Overall decent setup however if you’re looking for a sturdy basket this is not the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne

customer_reviews.title: Small S hook
customer_reviews.text: The S hook that secures the bottom of the sack to the bottom of the rack is too small to secure to my rack. My rack is 9 mm, sturdy. The opening to the S hook looks like 7 mm. So I had to Gerryrig another solution. Bags look ok so I don’t want to return them.
customer_reviews.author: JL

product_meta.title: Bushwhacker Omaha - Bicycle Grocery Pannier Cycling Rack Basket Bike Rear Bag Rear Accessories - Sold as Pair
product_meta.description: The Omaha grocery panniers are perfect for a quick trip to the market. They secure to the rack of your bike with a three-point mounting system. Each pannier will accommodate one full sized grocery bag, and when done folds flat for storage. Dimensions: 14" Length x 9" width x 11.5" height
feature_bullets: Two grocery panniers attach to the top of the rack with two metal hooks and the bottom of the rack or bike frame with a bungee and S Hook.
Each pannier will accommodate one full sized grocery bag.
When not in use folds flat for storage.
Dimensions: 14" Length x 9" width x 11.5" height

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
